org.jcvi.jillion.internal.align

Interface SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,B>,B extends ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>,A extends SequenceAlignment<R,S>>

  • Type Parameters:
    R - the Residue type used.
    S - the ResidueSequence type used.
    A - the SequenceAlignment used
    All Superinterfaces:
    Builder<A>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSequenceAlignmentBuilder, NucleotideSequenceAlignmentBuilder, ProteinSequenceAlignmentBuilder

    public interface SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R extends Residue,S extends ResidueSequence<R,S,B>,B extends ResidueSequenceBuilder<R,S>,A extends SequenceAlignment<R,S>>
extends Builder<A>
    SequenceAlignmentBuilder is a Builder that is used to build SequenceAlignments.
    Author:
    dkatzel

      • setAlignmentOffsets

        SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A> setAlignmentOffsets(int queryOffset,
                                                      int subjectOffset)
        Sets the offset of the first base in the alignment into the full length input sequence. This value is used to compute the values returned by SequenceAlignment.getQueryRange() and SequenceAlignment.getSubjectRange(). If this method is never called, then the start offset is assumed to be 0 for both the query and subject. If this object was constructed with the builtFromTraceback flag set to true, then this offset is actually the end coordinate of this alignment and the start coordinate is computed by subtracting the ungapped alignment length from these input values.
        Parameters:
        queryOffset - the offset into the query sequence.
        subjectOffset - the offset into the subject sequence.
        Returns:
        this.

      • addMismatches

        SequenceAlignmentBuilder<R,S,B,A> addMismatches(String query,
                                                String subject)
